title: Forms in React
subject: React
theory:
## Handling User Input
React normalizes form handling across browsers.

### Differences form HTML
1. **Textarea**: In HTML it uses children `<textarea>Value</textarea>`. In React, it uses `value` prop `<textarea value={txt} />`.
2. **Select**: Use `value` on the root `<select>` tag instead of `selected` attribute on option.

### Handling Multiple Inputs
Use a single object in state and update based on `e.target.name`.
